headline: Three Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies
description: Easy peanut butter cookies made with 3 ingredients: creamy peanut butter, sugar, and an egg. Great for kids learning to bake and ready in minutes!

video.description: See how to make super-easy, 5-star peanut butter cookies.
video.name: Three Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies

name: Three Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.

Mix peanut butter, white sugar, and egg in a medium bowl until smooth. Roll mixture into 1-inch balls and place 1 inch apart on an ungreased baking sheet; flatten each with a fork, making a criss-cross pattern.
Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are just barely brown on the bottoms, about 6 to 8 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I love it! I added half a cup of flour and it tasted nice!!
This is Thee BEST peanut butter cookie recipe!!! It's super easy to make and delicious. Thanks!! I'd like to add some chocolate chips next time. Would that alter the recipe too much?

Definitely need about 12 mins to set up and have a nicer texture. You have no choice but to leave them to cool on baking sheet longer as they'll fall apart. A little sprinkle of salt cuts abit of the sweetness.
I decided to make these me and my brother liked them, only complaint is they were really sweet you can feel the sugar crunching when you eat them.
Easy and affordable tasted just like they should . Less mess and taste great

This is so simple my 10 year old can make them. We substituted half of the sugar with brown sugar. We then made a second batch and added cocoa powder. In each batch we did half with creamy peanut butter and half with crunchy. ALL of them were DELICIOUS!!

I really thought this would come out of the oven a pan of good. But üò± these blew my mind! ü§Ø I grew up in the 80's and I'm not sure why no told me about this PB cookie recipe! And me being me, had to try and find out what the hype was about. Well let me tell you, anyone who loves Pb cookies and hasn't tried this recipe, have been done an injustice!!! These are FIRE!! I only wish baking all cookies were this quick easy! Then we would all be walking around looking like goofy cartoons animals slapping our tounges over the entirety of every place on our faces! üòãüòõüòú These cookies are SOOO GOOD!!! And are now my go to from now til I can no longer bake!! * i was going to take a pic but when I turned to get my phone, the only thing that was left was an empty plate and a few crumbs...ü§îü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è very successful in my opinion. :))

Excellent when you want a cookie now. I added a quarter cup of baking cocoa and an xtra egg and baked for 13 minutes at 350. Turned out with slight crispy top and smooth creamy chocolate/peanut butter inside. A go to cookie recipe that is easy and tasty.

It was super easy. Only note I have is to use a large egg. I used a medium egg as it didn't specify, and all i had on handwas mediumeggs. It didn't spread like a cookie should in baking. So. I'll remember that next time. They taste good though.

I absolutely loved the way these turned out. I used 2 cups of granulated white sugar, 2 cups of room temp Peanut butter and 2 eggs. Then I added a tsp of salt, two pinches of baking soda, and about 1/2 tsp of vanilla extract and baked at 350¬∞F for 12 minutes. I added a few chopped PB cups to the last few and they turned out great! I removed them directly from to plan to a coming rack immediately after removing them from the oven so they would stay extra soft and chewy. It wound up making about 2 dozen cookies.

For a super fast, super easy peanut butter cookie craving, yes, I‚Äôll make these again! But I much prefer the more traditional flour and butter and brown sugar and vanilla, etc., etc., peanut butter cookie. I followed this 3-ingredient recipe and method exactly but they were just ok, albeit satisfied a craving. Also, I did large walnut sized balls of dough that I flattened with a fork. I have no idea where y‚Äôall came up with ‚Äúbake 6-8 minutes‚Äù. Mine took 13 minutes. They do taste best when the bottom and edges are just slightly browned and crisp.
it tastes kinda like Peanut Butter fuge.
Followed the recipe and they turned out great üëç just let them cool down a bit before you try to eat them. Light and fluffy but will crumble easily.
Really good and easy, but a little soft at the 8 minute mark so I did 10-12

So easy to make and great taste. I did add a teaspoon of both vanilla and baking soda as well as a pinch of salt. Then I used a fork to flatten the cookies on the parchment paper in a criss cross form and put a little sugar on top before baking. My spouse told me these were the best cookies I have ever baked in the 28 years we have been together....and I make a mean chocolate chip cookie! ENJOY!

These aren‚Äôt the best cookies that I‚Äôve ever had but they‚Äôre pretty good. Some people are attributing this recipe to fad diet trends online‚ÄîI just wanted to set the record straight that this recipe is much older than the internet. You‚Äôll find this recipe in cook books from the 50s.

I made a huge batch of these last week, but used brown instead of white sugar. They were AWESOME. Not overly sweet, soft and chewy and easy. I found it easier to handle the sticky dough by refrigerating it slightly for scooping. I also gave them a sprinkle of confectioners sugar after they cooled.

Thu taste amazing but they turned out very melty. Maybe I just need to let them cool but they break apart very easy and are very bendy. I cooked them for about 10 minutes so idk the problem. Also VERY sweet which makes sense considering the ratio from peanut butter to sugar is the same but still

I had to use a little butter as I didn't have parchment paper. I also made them too big and didn't flatten them until partway through cooking, so they took much longer to cook. Still yummy :) leaves room for mistakes.

Did everything this recipe said, put in all the right ingredients and baked it at 350 and did the correct amount of time. It came out still as peanut butter, bubbling and melted all over the pan. It wasn't even a big cookie! This recipe doesn't work and I don't understand how it's working for everyone else.
